result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amarion M. Turner

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

9:05 AM Defendant Amarion M. Turner in court by video with attorney Michelle M Brandemuehl by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Activity:Return on warrant 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:13 PM Defendant Amarion M. Turner in court by video with attorney Kevin M Smith by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant vacated. Reinstate previous bond. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom. Time limits waived.
Return on warrant on May 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Activity: Non-appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:24 PM Attorney Michelle M Brandemuehl in court in person.  Intern Margaret Ginocchio by video supervised by David Zarwell by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Warrant ordered.  Can bond of $500 set.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial Appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.
No driving without valid drivers license or valid insurance.

03:26 PM Defendant Amarion M. Turner in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Michelle M Brandemuehl by video means.  Emmeline Lee  and Intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.  Signature bond of $1000 set, no driving without valid license and insurance, no driving after consumption of any intoxicants.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
